Description:
What to expect from this role?
We make sense of our customers' RFID data – you ensure our tailor-made RFID systems depict these data meaningfully.
A key element in our track and trace platform is the Turck Vilant Server, which collects and analyses data from a fixed and mobile RFID reader network. In addition, it provides a web-based user interface that, e.g., visualizes the movement of RFID-tagged assets for the user. It will be your task to develop further and design the front end of our Server applications.
You will join our skilled software team in Otaniemi, Espoo. The team works in a hybrid mode, partly from their home offices and partly from the office, so it will be up to you to choose where and how you would like to work, bearing in mind that we would like to see you at the office at a minimum once per week.

For our Product Development Center in Espoo, Finland (or remote location within Finland),
we are looking for an enthusiastic Software Engineer who will help us build a sustainable solution platform for our future growth. And that's where you come in!
About the Company
At Topcon Positioning Group, headquartered in Livermore, California, USA, we design, manufacture and distribute productivity tools for developing a brighter future. Whether cultivating the earth or building upon it, Topcon brings innovation in workflow automation and seamless connectivity of data to construction, geopositioning and agriculture industries focused on developing a sustainable tomorrow.

Description:
Elisa Data & Analytics department is responsible for development of large-scale analytics to various Elisa's business needs. We value the data and we are focused on learning how to support our customers better and want to produce experiences in our customers' everyday life.
We're looking for a Data Engineer for the Elisa Data & Analytics team to work together with our skilled Architect, Data Engineers and Scientists.
Your main project would be designing and implementing data integrations between different systems and engineering many kinds of solutions for data handling and machine learning. These complex systems require skills from data integration and solid coding experience.
In this job, you can use your skills in a creative and versatile way right at the heart of our company. You will get a chance to make your own system choices and direct development work in the right direction in line with your own vision.

Job_title: Grow as Data Engineer with us - Solita´s personalised onboarding program
Description:
Growing as a Data Engineer onboarding program helps you to boost your growth as a professional, improving your skills eg. in cloud platforms and their services, databases, data development tools and methodologies as well as more general level consulting skills. With a wider and deeper skillset you´ll have more opportunities to find meaningful and challenging projects to work in.
What Data Engineers do in Solita?
Data Engineers are all-around and end-to-end developers and consultants handling data in all its shapes and sizes in order to fulfil the end users' data needs. Data Engineers work together with the Solita team in various customer projects, where data platforms and various data utilisation solutions are built, data storages are modernised and data is processed.

Description:
We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our team!
Your tasks include building data pipelines to boost our data scientists work related to exploring new machine learning systems. Act as the technical expert between different teams on data related integrations for future projects.

Description:
SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT
FINLAND
DATA
Are you already an experienced data engineer or a talent wanting to pivot your role from software engineering to data engineering? We are building a Data and IoT Center of Excellence in Finland, so now is a perfect time to join the team to build something big. You will get to work side-by-side with top-of-the-world experts in data and IoT development.

At Nortal we help organizations harness the power of data and IoT with automated software solutions. Our software engineers are experts in building new hybrid applications in Cloud and Edge, and migrating legacy systems to this architecture. If you want to join an international and growing company, work in great and humorous teams without excess policies or hierarchies - then we have the perfect match for you!

Description:
JOIN YOUSICIAN
Yousician impacts and enriches the lives of millions of people by empowering them to play music they love, learn something new, and feel good in the everyday. We merge music and tech to amplify life. We reimagine the way people learn to play, so that everyone can play.
And, you don't need to be a musician to join Yousician!
We've built an amazing team of creative, passionate, and independent people, all working together to help millions of people learn, play, and have fun. If you are looking for a rewarding career opportunity in a growing and changing scale up business, you're in the right place!

Description:
The ideal candidate for this opening is someone who is willing to work crossfunctionally on both data science features and data processing at an ambitious startup.

Personally, you are:
Self-motivated
Honest and passionate
Learn quickly and continously
Meeshkan employees are those who:
Communicate effectively with clients and teammates
Curious about technology and the impact it can make on the world
Tasks

Requirements

Benefits

This role works closely with Mike Meeshkan’s CEO, and with the engineering team.


1. 30 minute video call with our COO, Makenna
2. Take home exercise, if applicable
3. Video call with Mike, CEO of Meeshkan
4. Offer & "What will make you most successful in this position?"

On average the whole process takes 2-3 weeks end to end, but we're pretty flexible!

We understand the combination of backend and data science chops, is a hard one to find. Our preference is on candidates with strong backend experience, we have an incredible team of data science engineers that you can collaborate with and learn from!

Even if you don't believe you fit all of the requirements but you're interested in the product / position — please apply! We're looking forward to hearing from you.

We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our team in Helsinki. You will be in charge of creating and managing technological infrastructure of data platforms, including data pipelines, data storage and BI interfaces for querying, modeling and reporting the data. You will work closely with our customers, helping them to make most of their data and to succeed in a data-driven cultural shift.
We expect you to have experience in:
Data analysis and data analysis platforms (preferably with AWS)
Data pipeline design and implementation
Data lake design and implementation
Data quality assurance and verification

Description:
Are you a skilled Data Engineer up for owning the data pipeline of an upcoming game, in line to be our second hit? Ready to join one of Europe's fastest growing game companies?

If yes, Metacore could be the right place for you
We are a Helsinki-based game company best known for our hit game Merge Mansion and our people-first company culture. Built on trust, our culture allows us to work autonomously, efficiently, and ambitiously. We have mutually agreed on five cultural norms to describe how we build trust and work as Metacore – you can find them here.

Our company’s mission is to entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades. Although we already entertain 40,000,000+ players worldwide and have grown into a team of 120+ game industry professionals in less than two years, we’re only getting started. That’s where we hope you come in: to take ownership of the data pipeline of one of our upcoming games, and ensure its reliability, scalability, and efficiency. Your expertise in data engineering, combined with your enthusiasm for data analysis, will enable you to generate informative visualizations and pursue engaging data science initiatives that enhance the team's performance.

Description:
DATA ENGINEER
Would you like to be a part of Recordly's story? Now is your chance! We’re looking for a Data Engineer who wants to get their hands dirty with different data solutions, platforms, and pipelines. Working at Recordly means you get to work with customers that truly want to make data their competitive edge. You will be at the core of helping businesses capitalize on the opportunities data offers.

“WHO/WHAT IS RECORDLY?” YOU MIGHT ASK
Recordly is an independent company party of the Futurice family specializing in business data management. Our core business focuses on data management, data architectures, and hands-on data engineering that enable exceptional user experiences, efficiency gains, and new business models. In simple terms, we tech the heck out of data.

Description:
Our team is comprised of four professionals. Each member has own specialized area, but we collaborate and support each other in technical challenges and in the development of best practices. We work in a hybrid model with broad remote work possibilities, but on-site meetings are required about twice per month. This is a permanent position. Start date is negotiable, but preferably in May 2023.
Working in the Data Integration Team, activities may include:
Expanding our standard data offering to the organization
Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data provided to our users

Description:
Solita Connected Data unit in Finland consists of more than 300 data and integration experts. With our growth, we are looking for Data Engineers to work on projects in different industries.
What would it be like?
Data Engineers work together with Solita team in various customer projects, where data platforms and various data utilisation solutions are built, data storages are modernised and data obtained from IoT sources is processed.
You have the possibility to influence what kind of project you want to work on. We want to find you a project that includes learning something new, the possibility to use your existing skills, and creating content that is meaningful to you.

Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we work closely with clients to embrace a transformational approach aimed at benefiting all stakeholders—empowering organizations to grow, build sustainable competitive advantage, and drive positive societal impact.

Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives that question the status quo and spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting, technology and design, and corporate and digital ventures. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, fueled by the goal of helping our clients thrive and enabling them to make the world a better place.

Description:
Työpaikan kuvaus
Haluaisitko rakentaa aikaa kestäviä dataratkaisuja ja kehittää pilvipohjaisia palveluja yhdessä muiden huippuasiantuntijoidemme kanssa? Olisimmeko me match made in data cloud? Jos sinulla on pää pilvissä mutta jalat maassa, saatat olla datatekemisemme hopeareunus.
Rekrytoimme aina sopivien dataosaajien osuessa kohdalle ja keskustelemme mielellämme kanssasi siitä, olisitko juuri sinä sopiva lisä tiimiimme. Data Engineerinä osallistut pilvipohjaisten tietoalustojen, dataputkien ja rajapintapalveluiden suunnitteluun, kehittämiseen ja ylläpitoon. Asiakasprojekteissamme teemme dataratkaisuja Snowflakeen, AWS:ään ja Azureen ja hyödynnämme lisäksi mm. GCP:tä ja SQL:ää. Asiakasprojektimme ovat monipuolisia, ja asiakastiimeissämme on asiakkuuden tai projektin koosta riippuen usein myös analytiikkakonsultteja, jotka visualisoivat dataa loppukäyttäjille, sekä web-kehittäjiä.

Description:
Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet
Dun & Bradstreet unlocks the power of data through analytics, creating a better tomorrow. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture and accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our 6,000+ global team members are passionate about what we do. We are dedicated to helping clients turn uncertainty into confidence, risk into opportunity and potential into prosperity. Bold and diverse thinkers are always welcome. Come join us!

Overview

We are strengthening our Data Operations team in Finland and looking for a Consumer Data Specialist. Data Operations is responsible for sourcing and acquiring new data, understanding the processes that generate the data we have, continuously improving the data quality, operating manual data processes, and supporting our clients and the organization in the availability and usability of our data assets.

Description:
Data Engineer
Tehtävässä olet osana tiivistä kehitys- ja ylläpitotiimiä, jonka työnä on rakentaa ja ylläpitää dataputkia sekä kehittää tietovarastointia pankkien viranomaisraportointiin. Menestymisen kannalta olennaisia ominaisuuksia ovat SQL-osaaminen, kiinnostus laajojen kokonaisuuksien hallintaan ja ongelmanratkaisuun sekä sitoutuminen jatkuvaan prosessiin, jossa dataputkia kehitetään ja automatisoidaan. Myös Azure-pilviympäristön tunteminen asettaa sinut etulyöntiasemaan.
Työn ytimen muodostavat datavirran end-to-end hallinnointi lähdejärjestelmistä raportointiin sekä datan jalostaminen käyttökelpoiseen muotoon. Käsiteltävä data liittyy mm. pankkien rahoitusinstrumentteihin ja datan käyttökohteet liittyvät pääosin pankkien riskienhallintaan ja viranomaisraportointiin, joten kiinnostus finanssialaa kohtaan ja ymmärrys pankkiliiketoiminnasta katsotaan eduksi. Tarkka tehtäväsi muotoutuu oman osaamisesi perusteella - tietovarastoinnin syväosaajana pääset aiheen vaikeiden kehitystehtävien pariin ja Azure-osaajana pääset toteuttamaan tietovarastointia myös pilvessä.

Description:
About Workato
Workato is the only integration and automation platform that is as simple as it is powerful — and because it's built to power the largest enterprises, it is quite powerful.
Simultaneously, it's a low-code/no-code platform. This empowers any user (dev/non-dev) to painlessly automate workflows across any apps and databases.
We're proud to be named a leader by both Forrester and Gartner and trusted by 7,000+ of the world's top brands such as Box, Grab, Slack, and more. But what is most exciting is that this is only the beginning.
Why join us?

Description:
Etsimme joukkoomme Data Engineeria mielenkiintoisten asiakashankkeiden pariin. Asiantuntijuus, tiimihenki ja ystävällisyys kuvastavat meitä hiqlaisia, samaa odotamme myös uudelta tiimiläiseltämme.
Data Engineerina työskentelet osana asiakastoimituksiamme. Laajasta asiakasverkostostamme löytyy keskisuuria ja suuria suomalaisia yrityksiä monilta eri toimialoilta.
Olemme erikoistuneet korkealaatuisiin digitaalisiin palveluihin, konsultointiin ja projektitoimituksiin. Ohjelmistokehitys, design, automaatio, dataosaaminen, pilvipalvelut, laadunvarmistus ja jatkuvat palvelut kuuluvat kaikki erityisosaamiseemme.
Kehittäjiltämme odotamme asiantuntemusta ja aitoa intoa teknologiaa kohtaan. Asiakaslähtöisyys ja tiimityöskentelytaidot ovat meidän asiakkuuksissamme avainasemassa. Innostava työyhteisö ja asiantunteva tiimi sekä aktiivinen kompetenssinkehitys ja tiedonjako tukevat onnistumista.

Description:
Fidelix is a Finnish-based technology company that makes smarter buildings for a healthier future. We manufacture, deploy, and maintain automation systems and IoT solutions for smart buildings, with customers in the Nordics, the Benelux, and 30 countries worldwide. Our mission is to make buildings smarter to become carbon neutral, energy-efficient, and CO2-emission aware. Our goal is to become the #1 choice automation solution for building owners across the Nordics, as well as the most wanted employer in the entire industry by 2025. Fidelix Group has today turnover of 60M€ and about 400 employees.
About the role
We have an exciting opportunity for a Group Component & Design Engineer to join our Supply Chain and Business Applications team at Fidelix Group. The team is small but skillful having a Sourcing Manager and a Business Applications Manager. You also work closely with product development, product managers and sales teams. As a group function, we work with all Fidelix Group companies: Fidelix Oy, EcoGuard AB, Lansen AB and Larmia AB. The component engineer will report to Chief Supply Chain Officer.
The workplace is in recently renovated Fidelix Group headquarters in Vantaa, next to the Vantaankoski railway station. The role is new and you will have the opportunity to develop the role further in the future.
Pros: ['"Good people and management." (in 1 reviews)']
Cons: ['"High employee turnover, benefits might not last." (in 1 reviews)', '"Which is terrible because problematic attitudes and recurring issues are never addressed or fixed." (in 1 reviews)']

Description:
We are looking for a motivated and disciplined software engineer with at least 3 years of experience in building high-performing, well-tested and secure applications. You will be joining our talented team in Helsinki, taking a large ownership of the software development lifecycle and continuously iterating on processes to deliver high quality software that helps our users compare financial products to save time and money.
What we can offer you
An opportunity to join a compact team where you'll get experience across several technologies and a chance to work alongside positive, motivated and dedicated colleagues. We work in a fast paced environment with a low hierarchy with the policy that the best idea wins. We all work from our office located in the heart of Helsinki (occasional remote work is possible).

Etsimme kokeneita Data Engineeraja työskentelemään sekä pohjoismaissa että kansainvälisesti vaikuttavissa asiakasprojekteissa. Meillä pääset suunnittelemaan ja toteuttamaan moderneja data-ratkaisuja pilvipalveluiden päälle. Suomessa tukenasi on 50 hengen data- , ohjelmistokehitys-, design- sekä strategiatyön osaajien työyhteisö.
Arki Data Engineerinä
Meillä työskentelet yhdessä Thoughtworksin tiimin kanssa asiakasprojekteissa. Pääset työskentelemään Thougthworksiläisten kanssa vaihtelevissa projekteissa, jotka kestävät pääasiassa muutamasta kuukaudesta puoleen vuoteen, mutta löytyy meiltä pidempiäkin projekteja. Asiakasprojekteissamme rakennetaan muun muassa tietovarastoja, kerätään datoja asiakkaan järjestelmistä ja jalostetaan niistä asiakkaan datastrategiaa palvelevia datatuotteita. Työskentelet yhdessä Data Scientistien kanssa ja pääset rakentamaan dataputkia osana koneoppimisen ja tekoäly-projektien toteuttamista (käsittää esimerkiksi koneoppimista, lineaarista ohjelmointia, generatiivista mallinnusta, syy-seurauspäättelyä/kausaalipäättelyä).

Description:
Löytyykö sinusta draivia monipuolisiin asiakasprojekteihin, joissa sinulle mahdollistetaan ammatillinen kasvu nyt ja tulevaisuudessa?
Oletko tietomallinnuksen ja/tai ETL- kehittämisen osaaja ja etsit itsellesi kasvumahdollisuuksia? Data- ja analytiikkaprojektiemme kasvun myötä etsimme Data Engineeria kehittämään asiakkaidemme liiketoimintaa.
Mistä on kyse?
Data & Analytics -liiketoiminnallamme on pitkä kokemus analyyttisista sovelluksista, joissa suurten tietomassojen käsittely ja hallinta ovat arkipäivää. Suunnittelemme ja toteutamme asiakkaillemme tiedonhallinnan ja analytiikan ratkaisuja, jotka palvelevat ja mahdollistavat monipuolisen tiedon hyödyntämisen suoraan liiketoiminnan tarpeisiin. Valitsemme käyttämämme teknologiat aina asiakastarpeen mukaisesti, mutta hyödynnämme ratkaisuissamme erityisesti Azurea.

Description:
Are you interested in working on the leading financial management product in Finland? Netvisor is looking for an ambitious Data Engineer to build a greenfield data platform.
Netvisor SaaS-products already serve over 30 000 businesses in Finland; over 1 million invoices are sent and 135 000 payslips are created monthly. Visma Solutions Oy is also a unicorn company with a revenue of 104M € in 2022.
Who are we looking for?
You have experience building ETL pipelines and applying modern data modelling techniques. You are proactive, collaborative and an excellent problem solver. You value teamwork but can take ownership and contribute independently, when necessary.
Our working language is English, and we expect good communication skills in both written and spoken English. Finnish skills are not mandatory, but they may help when you come across some of our existing data.

Description:
One of Finland's largest energy companies with a clear goal set out to be a 100% carbon neutral energy company by 2030. Great if candidates are passionate about their work making a real difference to the world with their work


Role & Responsibilities

Real time streaming analytics is going to be so crucial in collecting data from multiple sources e.g wind turbines, solar panels, thermal energy from the ocean, nuclear reactors. This is the key towards the company being carbon neutral - this hire will join a growing team who are making this important focus become a reality!


Skills & Qualifications




Benefits

d.field@nigelfrank.com

+358 75 3266 582

All interviews will be carried out remotely.

Job_title: Data and integration professionals for industrial domain
Description:
Manufacturing industries are living in an era of accelerated change and rapid demand for renewal. Industrial digitalisation, servitization, green transition and recent volatility in economics are shaping the way organizations create value and interact with each other. Our mission is to support manufacturing businesses to turn the change into a competitive advantage with a comprehensive digital expertise that combines technology, data and human insight.
Our industrial customer portfolio consists of large enterprises and corporations from asset intensive process industries to world-class intelligent equipment OEMs. If you are a consultative data professional or technical data expert with manufacturing or R&D background, please consider joining our relaxed and caring community of 350+ data experts in Finland. In the era of hybrid work your physical location is less relevant but we do have offices and hubs in the largest cities of Finland: Helsinki, Tampere, Turku, Oulu, Lahti, Jyväskylä, Joensuu, Kuopio and Pori.

Description:
Responsibilities:
Manage Desktop Devices (hardware, software and connectivity) incidents through to resolution.
Manage IMAC and desk side support services.
Manage hard and soft break fix services for laptops and desktops.
Provide standard and approved hardware and software (operating systems and standard office applications) support and maintenance on Desktop (Field Users) Devices for their entire lifecycle (including the remote management of Desktop Devices using appropriate tools).
Support, Manage, Optimize and Maintain the configuration and installation of the Desktop, to include, but not limited to, patch updates, hardware replacements, with spares provided by vendor.

Description:
Tuxera is looking for an experienced Field Applications Engineer.

You will work as a crucial liaison between our customers and the R&D team. You support business development and customer accounts by working on technical support projects, with strong support from the team. In the projects, you also ensure the schedules and deliveries are aligned with the project plans.
Your daily work includes the following:
Support customers through the integration phase of Tuxera products by offering integration advise
Support product evaluation testing by bridging customers and Tuxera R&D for possible questions in the process

Description:
Are you a Machine Learning Engineer looking to make a real difference in the world? Do you have a passion for using cutting-edge technology to save lives? We are an AI medical imaging startup with a focus on cardiovascular disease and its impact. Our mission is to revolutionise the way doctors and patients approach the diagnosis and treatment of cardiovascular disease, and we need your help.
We're looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our team and work on developing machine learning models that improve the accuracy and speed of cardiovascular disease diagnosis, ultimately leading to better patient outcomes and lives saved.
As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll work closely with our data science team to design, develop, and test machine learning models that can analyze medical images and provide accurate diagnoses. You'll be responsible for developing and implementing the algorithms that power our software platform.
